content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are given a markdown document `md` with many lines. Write a function `q_and_a_extractor` to extract all text in the markdown sections Question and Answer (starting with `# Question` and `# Answer`, respectively) and return the answer as a NamedTuple with keys `question` and `answer`. For a section to be valid, it must start at the beginning of the line. Strip any leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text. Provide example.

# Answer

```julia
function q_and_a_extractor(md::AbstractString)
    questions = Regex(r"^# Question\s*", "m")
    answers   = Regex(r"^# Answer\s*", "m")
    qa_pairs  = filter(line -> occursin(questions, line) || occursin(answers, line), split(md, '\n'))
    valid_qas = [x for x in qa_pairs if ismatch(questions, x) !== nothing && ismatch(answers, nextind(qa_pairs, findall(questions, x)[end])) !== nothing]
    q_and_a_tuples = [(strip(line_with_question) => strip(line_after_question)) for (line_with_question, line_after_question) in zip(valid_qas[1:end-1], valid_qas[2:end])]
    NamedTuple{Tuple(Symbol.(["question", "answer"]),}(q_and_a_tuples))
end

# Example usage with a sample markdown document:
md = raw"""
# Question
Some text before the answer.
# Answer
The answer to the question.

# Another Question
More text before another answer.
# Answer
Another answer.
"""
q_and_a_extractor(md)
```

This function will return a `NamedTuple` with keys `:question` and `:answer`, containing the extracted questions and answers from the markdown document. Note that the examples provided are for illustrative purposes only; in practice, you should ensure that your markdown document adheres to the expected format.
